intro: Niota commersonii, commonly known as the Commerson's niota, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in riparian habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
